newsitem.title: JAPAN: S&P says reaffirms BOT-Mitsubishi ratings.
newsitem.headline: S&P says reaffirms BOT-Mitsubishi ratings.

text.p: Standard and Poor's (S&P) said on Tuesday that it has reaffirmed the long- and short-term ratings of Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi Ltd (BOT-Mitsubishi) and its affiliates.

The rating agency said that the ratings remained unchanged despite the bank's announcement last month that its U.S. unit had posted an appraisal loss of some $50 million from taking positions in such instruments as U.S. interest rate swaps.
S&P said in a statement that the loss was fairly small when compared with the scale of financial resources of the parent bank, and that no irregular or unfair deals had been detected.

The ratings outlook remains negative, it said. S&P said it was still concerned about the possibility of large banks, including BOT-Mitsubishi suffering losses in order to support banks in bad financial health.
